title: Are charcoal and biochar the same thing? - Quora

response.answer_text: They aren’t quite the same thing. Charcoal (the hardwood kind, not briquettes) has to be inoculated, first, to become biochar. There are many videos of this easy process on YouTube, and it’s vital to do this step if you want to use the biochar right away. The lazy alternative is to shove the char into a compost pile for a year, then use it. this works fairly well, since it won’t be absorbing nutrients from the soil like straight char will, but it isn’t quite as effective as inocculating it because it won’t have the ideal fungal/bacterial mix for your particular soil and plants, at least not at first.
both are composed of biomass. the difference is that the substance (wood, bones etc ) whose charcoal is made is contaminated with fungi or bacteria or any other microbe.
